intro: Alsine apetala, commonly known as the petalless alsine, is a low-growing annual herb belonging to the family Molluginaceae. It is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces tiny, white flowers that lack petals, giving it its common name. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Alsine apetala is typically found in regions of North America and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions.
